The_Peach_Pickers:
{{Short description|American songwriting team}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Peach Pickers | image = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | alias = | origin = [[Valdosta, Georgia]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2004–present | associated_acts = [[Blake Shelton]], [[Luke Bryan]] | current_members = [[Rhett Akins]]
[[Dallas Davidson]]
[[Ben Hayslip]] }} '''The Peach Pickers''' are an American [[songwriting]] team, composed of [[Rhett Akins]], [[Dallas Davidson]], and [[Ben Hayslip]]. Akins and Hayslip met while attending high school together in [[Valdosta, Georgia]], before Akins signed a contract with [[Decca Records]] in the mid-1990s. Davidson began songwriting in college, where he was roommates with singer [[Luke Bryan]] at Georgia Southern University. He and Akins met in 2004 when the two co-wrote "Kiss My Country Ass", which both Akins and [[Blake Shelton]] recorded. After Akins brought Davidson to a songwriting session, the three began holding songwriting meetings every Wednesday.{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.theboot.com/2011/01/31/peach-pickers-songs/ |title=Peach Pickers — Behind the Spotlight |publisher=Theboot.com |date=2011-01-31 |accessdate=2014-08-22}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/nashville/news/2012/11/05/peach-pickers-success-from-peristent.html?page=all |title=Peach Pickers songwriting trio finds success with weekly quotas - Nashville Business Journal |publisher=Bizjournals.com |date=2012-11-05 |accessdate=2014-08-22}} Among the songs that they have written together are Shelton's "[[All About Tonight (Blake Shelton song)|All About Tonight]]", [[Josh Turner]]'s "[[All Over Me (Josh Turner song)|All Over Me]]", [[Jack Ingram]]'s "[[Barefoot and Crazy]]", [[Brooks & Dunn]]'s "[[Put a Girl in It]]", [[Joe Nichols]]' "[[Gimmie That Girl]]", and Bryan's "[[I Don't Want This Night to End]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2012/11/the-insiders-view-the-peach-pickers/ |title=The Insider's View: The Peach Pickers : MusicRow – Nashville's Music Industry Publication – News, Songs From Music City |publisher=Musicrow.com |date=2012-11-20 |accessdate=2014-08-22}} All three members of the team also have co-writers' credits outside their collaborations. In 2022, the trio began touring as a performing act on Luke Bryan's tour.{{cite web | url=https://www.countrystandardtime.com/news/newsitem.asp?xid=12354 | title=Bryan hits the farms again | publisher=[[Country Standard Time]] | date=April 29, 2022 | accessdate=July 25, 2022}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{official website|http://www.peachpickers.com}} {{Rhett Akins}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Peach Pickers}} [[Category:American country songwriters]] [[Category:American male songwriters]] [[Category:People from Valdosta, Georgia]] [[Category:American songwriting teams]] [[Category:Songwriters from Georgia (U.S. state)]] {{US-songwriter-stub}}
